formatDescription: The File Allocation Table is a file system architecture used across a range of computer systems. This entry aims to capture instances where the file system has been exported as a portable disk image. It may be possible and desirable to distinguish between different types of FAT image. Please contact the PRONOM team if you can assist with this.
provenanceCompoundName: National Library of Scotland / National Library of Scotland

internalSignatures.name: FAT Disk Image
internalSignatures.note: BOF: Jump instruction bytes 1 and 3 - 0XEB{1}0x90, byte 14 = Sectors per cluster, any from 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, or 128

relationships.relatedFormatName: exFAT (Extensible File Allocation Table) Disc Image
